Talon:

"So are we m


From: Kraftlos 
Sent: Sunday, May 10, 2009 10:36 PM
=
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: The Crash Landing and Aftermath


=



Salveo landed their last remaining shuttle atop the metal slab that
once=
 was the Maximal Base. The cargo ramp lowered and the crew walked
out into =
the scene of the disaster. They were greeted by Lord Perseus
who stopped di=
gging through debris to fill them in on what happened.

"Right before the t=
idal wave hit, we saw a massive ship fly overhead,
not 300m above us." he s=
aid. "Something that massive falling from
orbit could easily explain the fo=
rce of the water."

"How's the rest of the city," asked Salveo.

"Not good.=
 Most the people escaped to their shelters, however the
buildings were all =
destroyed. Except the tower and several on the far
side of the island."

"T=
he shuttles?"

"Ours was destroyed, a few were in the air when the wave hit=
."

"I dont think we can rebuild this." said Salveo after a moment of
looki=
ng at the devistation.

"I think its possible, but unwise. I think this giv=
es us a new
opportunity to rejoin our Maximal allies and pool our resources=
. So
for the moment, we should recover what we can and put it into the
shut=
tle, then assist Atlantis in anyway possible."

"Rejoin Lord Elder? Will th=
at work? And what about Atlantis?"

"Atlantis will be safe from the Unicron=
ians; they wont bother with a
few hundred scientists and fisherman. What th=
ey want is to destroy
us, and they will follow us wherever we decide to hav=
e our base. As
for that crashed ship, I dont think its wise to mount a expe=
dition
while the city lies in ruin and we remain baseless."

"Right, so pri=
ority one, help the city and recover what we can from
our base." replied Sa=
lveo.

"Correct."

On 4/30/09, airly2002@... <airly2002@...=
> wrote:
> Talon:
>
>
> Talon nodded and Followed Lord Elder.
>
>
> Kup.
>
=
> Kup followed salveo but he still regrets to leave Roddy, windlord and
> N=
ightlight behind
>
>
>
>
>
> From: Kraftlos
> Sent: Monday, April 27, 2009 =
8:25 PM
> To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: The Crash Landing and A=
ftermath
>
>
>
>
>
> Lord Perseus opened the door to the lower level of the=
 base, and water
> poured into the room. He motioned for everyone to follow=
.
>
> "It looks like that ship we saw crash landed in the ocean..." he said=

> mater of factly. "Look at this place."
>
> What had once been their base=
 was now a slab of concrete and metal
> with the ocasional structural suppo=
rt poking up from the foundation.
> The city, in just as bad of shape, was =
errily flat with a large number
> of buildings simply washed away.
>
> "Loo=
ks like we need a new base." said Guardia steping quietly behind
> Lord Per=
seus, sloshing water with each step.
>
> "This base was build from an old h=
anger, it wasnt intended to take
> that kind of punishment. We could rebuil=
d here, or we could find a
> better location. First we need to make sure th=
e townsfolk are ok;
> I'll try to signal Salveo's team, we're going to need=
 that shuttle."
>
> Meanwhile...
>
> Celeron lept up from his chair to stai=
r at some strange radar
> readings. An entire sector on the map had tempora=
rily darkened, then
> went clear again. The mass that represnted Atlantis d=
idnt look right.
> He knew it had changed in the last minion attack; but th=
is didnt even
> look like the same city anymore.
>
> "Blast... looks like w=
e need to go see what's going on." said Celeron
> to himself. "Predecons! R=
eport!"
>
> OOC: This would be the Iron Skull predecon base,
>
> Meanwhile.=
..
>
> Salveo walked into the room where Lord Elder was working.
>
> "Atlan=
tis was just devastated by a tidal wave. We're going to have to
> go back t=
here and assist them.; our base was destroyed."
>
> On 4/24/09, airly2002@h=
otmail.com <airly2002@...> wrote:
>> Talon:
>>
>> "WHAT THE PIT IS =
GOING HERE????" Cursed Talon, in a minion way, while she
>> followed guardi=
a and Lord Perseus
>>
>>
>>
>>

>> From: Kraftlos
>> Sent: Tuesday,=
 April 21, 2009 6:08 PM

>> Subject: The Crash=
 Landing and Aftermath
>>
>>
>>
>>
>>
>>
>> The engines had been losing pow=
er for the last day and a half; but finally
>> the gigantic craft could no =
longer fight the forces that pulled on it and
>> its orbit began to decay. =
Knowing that their only hope of survival was to
>> safely crash land, the p=
ilot picked an open area of ocean and tried to
>> approach at a safe angle =
to slow itself enough to keep the ship intact.
>>
>> Lord Perseus and his c=
rew walked along the bridge that crossed the gap
>> between the part of the=
 island where the hangers were located and the
>> peninsula area where the =
base sat. Suddenly the sky became dark and a
>> rumbling noise could be hea=
rd, growing louder and louder. He looked up to
>> see almost the whole sky =
occupied by a massive starship seemly heading
>> straight for the island. T=
he Atlantis emergency alarm started to sound and
>> civilians rushed to the=
ir shelters.
>>
>> "Everyone! To the base! Hurry!" ordered Perseus breaking=
 out into a run.
>>
>> The rumbling sound continued to get louder. As Perse=
us and his crew
>> reached
>> the base door, it was quickly opened for them=
 then shut behind them. He
>> ordered everyone to move the lower level of t=
he base. As the ship passed
>> over the island, the sound grew so loud that=
 the ground shook and weaker
>> parts of buildings started to crumble, as i=
n an earthquake. The ship
>> traveled for another three miles before it tou=
ched down in the deep ocean
>> waters. The force of the impact sent the shi=
p hundreds of feet below the
>> surface and it continued to sink until comi=
ng to rest on the top of an
>> underwater mountain. The mass of water displ=
aced by the ship started a
>> massive tsunami-like wave, going out in all d=
irections.
>>
>> The ground began to shake again and the lights flickered i=
nside the
>> Maximal
>> base.
>>
>> "Sir, what's that noise?" Guardia asked=
, sealing the last heavy door to
>> the
>> underground section of the base.=

>>
>> The lights continued to flicker, then went out.
>>
>> At that moment=
 the ten-story-high wall of water struck Atlantis from the
>> east, picking=
 up all the boats in the harbor and tossing them onto the
>> land.
>> The p=
arts of the docks that were not made of concrete were pushed up and
>> dest=
royed. A moment later the water hit the buildings in the lower wharf
>> are=
a and they immediately collapsed under the intense weight of water.
>> Like=
wise the metal dome that made up the upper story of the Maximal base
>> was=

>> immediately ripped from its foundations and carried away, along with
>>=
 everything in the command center, the armory, mess hall, and the main bank=

>> of CR chambers were also picked up and carried away.
>>
>> The lower fl=
oor of the base had a large metal slab to protect it from
>> bombing, and a=
s the water continued to pour over it, everything on the
>> upper
>> floors=
 was ripped away, leaving a clean plate of metal sitting at the
>> bottom
>=
> of the crater that was the base. The buildings along the center of the
>>=
 town
>> were a little sturdier and remained standing, though heavily damag=
ed. The
>> hanger and all the craft in it were picked up and thrown into th=
e ocean.
>>
>> As the water came to tower it filled up the deep trench arou=
nd the
>> structure
>> then the wall hit it, wrapping it entirely except fo=
r the top five
>> stories,
>> damaging supports, breaking out all the windo=
ws and destroying the bridges
>> that allowed access to the tower. The wave=
 then continued across the rest
>> of the island, destroying buildings and =
carrying away the mass of debris,
>> and then all was eerily quiet.
>>
>>
>=
>
>
>
>
